title: Ticket #4792: simple option to condor_q to query the negotiator's autocluster
description:
To perform matching (to determine what pilots are needed), glideinWMS currently queries the schedd for all jobs matching a certain constraint, returning several significant attributes. We've found that this query is prohibitively expensive - on a test with 500k idle jobs in queue, this took over 40 minutes to return However, glideinWMS takes the result of the query and counts the number of jobs with identical significant attributes (the total count is then used to gauge demand). In other words - it performs auto-clustering! If the schedd could provide the auto-clusters (and job count per auto-cluster) as a query protocol, then we could greatly reduce the cost of the query.

There is no immediate need to query anything other than the autocluster information currently built by the schedd.

note: this ticket is the former #4613, since the scope of that task was substantially reduced after that ticket already had several commits (that no longer apply.)
remarks:
2014-Sep-26 16:56:14 by tannenba:
Does glideInWMS need or expect these resource request counts in any particular order? For instance, does glideInWMS expect to receive these requests in FIFO or job priority order? I don't know if it tries to create glideins for the 'most important' jobs first, or if that doesn't matter.... I think the answer is glideinWMS does not expect any particular ordering, but I am not sure, and it could be important.

Also, does the condor_q performed now by glideinwms have both a constraint (selection) and a projection via -format or -autoformat ? If so, can I assume that the attributes requested in the projection are the significant attributes that glideinwms wants to autocluster with? I think the answer is yes, based on phone conversations, but would like confirmation from someone knowledgeable on glideinWMS implementation. Thanks.

2014-Sep-26 17:04:48 by bbockelm:
Hi ToddT,

In my understanding of the code and previous discussions with the developers, I don't believe job ordering matters. Only the total job counts matter, as this is used to estimate the number of glideins to request.

I can confirm that both a projection and constraint appear to be used.

I have previously added Burt as a watcher and hope he can chime in if I'm wrong.

Brian

2014-Dec-18 17:45:53 by johnkn:
To make this work, there are two fairly small changes needed

  1. Change the schedd to keep track of the count of jobs for each autocluster
  2. Add a -autocluster command to condor_q which will return the autocluster information including the count of jobs in each autocluster.
